page.title: 01Market Harborough
page.content: M.H. is in the southern-most part of Leicestershire. Originally a new market town in the C.12th,it is still important for its cattle market,as it is situated within some of the best grazing land in the country.M.H.grew in importance in the C.19th.with the local corsetry firm{Symingtons,}which utilized the canal/rail links.M.H. retains a strong communications network,being on a major rail line and on one of the main east/west roads_the A427,+the A6.{(Much local opposition {at present to traffic through town) 0ther industries include food,electric batteries,rubber.However the town has managed on rhe whole to incorporate new industry without drastic upheaval. Its a popular fox hunting area,Prince Charles often rides.Many findthe sport cruel.M.H.covers an area of approx.6sq km.The present pop.is 14,944(1984).
